subject: Re: Address picker not working
preview: 📝 Ticket Overview    Detail Description Subject Critical Checkout Failure (Address Picker) & Downtime Logging Client Mitchell Palmer / Nansi Philips (Aussie Industries) Status ✅ Resolved   1.

full_threads.body:
📝 Ticket Overview

Detail
Description
Subject
Critical Checkout Failure (Address Picker) & Downtime Logging
Client
Mitchell Palmer / Nansi Philips (Aussie Industries)
Status
✅ Resolved


1. Checkout Issue & Technical Fix (Dec 1)


  • The Problem: Mitchell reported that the address picker functionality on the checkout page was not working, preventing customers from completing orders.
  • Resolution: Adriane identified the issue as a "minor hiccup" (later apologized for the poor phrasing) with the Google Maps Places API. The conflict was resolved, and checkout was restored within minutes of being reported.
  • Root Cause: The failure was caused by a recent security infrastructure update from Google that required a specific, manual configuration change on the Google Cloud Project to meet new security standards.

2. Client Feedback & Monitoring Explanation (Dec 1)


  • Client Feedback: Nansi Philips expressed concern over the issue not being resolved immediately, questioning the monitoring protocol.
    Support Explanation: Adriane apologized for the initial poor phrasing ("minor hiccup") and explained the monitoring limitations:
    • 24/7 uptime monitoring (Kinsta/Blogvault) catches server outages immediately.
    • However, silent third-party API changes (like Google's security updates) do not trigger standard server-down alerts.
    • The manual update was required to securely match Google's new external standards.

3. Downtime Log & Timeline (Current)


  • Request: Nansi requested a log showing how long the checkout functionality was impacted.
    Action Taken: Support pulled transaction data and server logs to provide a precise timeline:
    • Impacted Duration: Approximately 2 hours.
      Timeline (Sydney Time):
      • 09:21 AM: Site fully operational (Confirmed by Order #9854).
      • 09:21 AM – 11:35 AM: Incident Window (Conflict due to Google infrastructure update).
      • 11:35 AM: Issue Resolved (Update authorized; functionality restored).
      • 11:39 AM: Stability Confirmed (Test Order #9856 verified).
  • Analogy: The issue was explained as a "high-security building" scenario: Google changed the locks (the update), and the Wolf IQ firewall blocked entry until the new "keys" (configuration settings) were issued, ensuring the hosting environment remains secure.

Hi Nansi,

Thanks for reaching out to Wolf IQ Support and apologies for the delay in getting back to you.

I’ve pulled the transaction data and logs from our Google Cloud server and order transactions to give you the exact details.

The functionality was impacted for approximately 2 hours.

Here is the timeline based on the logs (Sydney Time):
  • 09:21 AM: Site Fully Operational. Confirmed by successful customer Order #9854.
  • 09:21 AM – 11:35 AM: Incident Window. A background infrastructure update from Google conflicted with strict security settings.
  • 11:35 AM: Issue Resolved. We authorised the update and traffic was restored immediately.
  • 11:39 AM: Stability Confirmed. Verified via test Order #9856.

The downtime wasn't due to a plugin error, but rather a security protocol. Think of it like a high-security building: Google changed the locks (the infrastructure update), and our firewall blocked entry until we verified and issued the new keys.

This strict approach ensures your hosting environment remains secure. Everything is running smoothly now and we are monitoring the site closely.

Happy to help if you need anything else.

Can I please see a log on how long this part of the website was down for ?



Nansi Philips
​​​​

Operations Manager

Hi Nansi,

Thanks for reaching out and sharing your feedback. I completely understand your concern and appreciate you raising this.

First off, my sincere apologies for the earlier wording. You are absolutely right, any issue preventing customers from checking out is significant and definitely not minor. We missed the mark with that phrasing.

To answer your question regarding the cause and our monitoring:
  • The Cause: This was a result of a recent security implementation by Google regarding their Maps Places API. This external change required a specific manual configuration update on the Google Cloud Project to match their new standards.
  • The Monitoring: We do have 24/7 uptime monitoring on our Kinsta and Blogvault which catches site outages immediately. However, third-party API changes (like this specific one from Google) can sometimes occur silently without triggering a standard server down alert.

Now that the configuration is updated, the connection is secure. We are also reviewing our specific API alerts to ensure we can catch these third-party updates even faster in the future.

We value your partnership and are committed to keeping your site performance high.

Rest assured, we are always monitoring the website.

Always happy to help.

Minor ?
Why don't we have things in place so that you (wolf iq) can resolve these issues immediately without us having to call you

Pls advise



Nansi Philips

​​​​

Operations Manager

📝 Ticket Summary: Checkout Address Picker Issue

Detail
Description
Subject
Checkout Page Address Picker Failure
Client
Mitchell Palmer (Aussie Industries)
Status
✅ Resolved

Issue Description

Mitchell reported an urgent issue on the checkout page:
  • The Problem: The address picker functionality was not working, preventing customers from successfully completing their checkout process.

Resolution

Action Taken:
  • Adriane investigated the checkout functionality.
  • The Fix: The issue was identified as a "minor hiccup" related to the Places API (the service responsible for address lookup/autocompletion). Support corrected the configuration or resolved the API connection issue.
  • Outcome: The address picker is confirmed to be working correctly again, and the checkout process is fully functional.

Hi Mitchell,

Thanks for reaching out to Wolf IQ Support!

Good news - the issue is now resolved. It was just a minor hiccup with the Places API (the tool that finds the addresses), but we’ve smoothed it out and everything is working perfectly again.

Give us a shout if you need anything else! Happy Monday!

action.text: Allie Borcena assigned to Adriane Roa
